body_html:
Just that it was older and seemed more likely to be supported. I will return to 10.13.4 and try that. I'm actually currently focusing on getting a Linux 16.04 similarly-configured partition to work, but it's also failing. Everything seems fine until I try to open Spyder in Anaconda -- it comes up just black instead of the usual white-background boxes. Not black background -- fully, black, no visible text. Smells like a driver issue of some kind...non-pytorch conda environments can run Spyder just fine. I'm currently trying building from source instead of the binaries. I'll switch back to OSX if this doesn't pan out. I should know any minute now.
…
On Mon, May 21, 2018 at 11:23 AM, cpuhrsch ***@***.***> wrote: We'll be better able to help you with 10.13 since our contbuild system and development platforms are based on 10.13. Is there a particular reason you chose 10.12 over 10.13? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#7721 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/APJZbUhG0j25fWcIucDEILPegEV_eBmeks5t0wY-gaJpZM4UGVB0> .

return to 10.13.4 and try that. I'm actually currently focusing on getting

failing. Everything seems fine until I try to open Spyder in Anaconda -- it
comes up just black instead of the usual white-background boxes. Not black
background -- fully, black, no visible text. Smells like a driver issue of

currently trying building from source instead of the binaries. I'll switch
back to OSX if this doesn't pan out. I should know any minute now.

body:
Just that it was older and seemed more likely to be supported. I will
return to 10.13.4 and try that. I'm actually currently focusing on getting
a Linux 16.04 similarly-configured partition to work, but it's also
failing. Everything seems fine until I try to open Spyder in Anaconda -- it
comes up just black instead of the usual white-background boxes. Not black
background -- fully, black, no visible text. Smells like a driver issue of
some kind...non-pytorch conda environments can run Spyder just fine. I'm
currently trying building from source instead of the binaries. I'll switch
back to OSX if this doesn't pan out. I should know any minute now.

On Mon, May 21, 2018 at 11:23 AM, cpuhrsch <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> We'll be better able to help you with 10.13 since our contbuild system and
> development platforms are based on 10.13. Is there a particular reason you
> chose 10.12 over 10.13?
>
> —
